remarks: The cosine of the argument is the quotient of the real part and the absolute value.  Compare to ~ efiarg .  (Contributed by David Moews, 28-Feb-2017.)
statement:
cosargd.1 $e |- ( ph -> X e. CC ) $.
cosargd.2 $e |- ( ph -> X =/= 0 ) $.
cosargd $p |- ( ph -> ( cos ` ( Im ` ( log ` X ) ) ) = ( ( Re ` X ) / ( abs ` X ) ) ) $.
